components.name: azvqQo
components.content:
RPA needs to register you as a business on their system (the Rural Payments service) before they can give you a CPH number. They must do this even if you keep livestock as pets or for a hobby.

If you do not have a business name, enter your full name.

pages.title: Is your business address the same as your home address?

components.name: CMTiOK
components.title: Is your business address the same as your home address?
components.hint: If you do not have a business, select 'yes'.

components.name: KVSTXs
components.content:
RPA needs the legal status of your business to register you on the Rural Payments service.

If you do not have a business, select 'sole proprietorship'.

Read more about registering a business (opens in new tab) or find out more about charity types (opens in new tab). If you're not sure, seek professional advice.

components.title: Companies House number
components.hint: The number will be on any documents you have received from Companies House. It's either an 8-digit number or 2 letters followed by a 6-digit number, for example, 03256178 or AC032561.

pages.title: Is your business a market, showground or zoo?

components.name: jLxphO
components.title: Is your business a market, showground or zoo?

components.name: NRlngf
components.content:
Tell us when livestock or animal by-products will arrive. This date must be no more than 6 weeks from today's date. If they will arrive later, do not apply for your CPH number now.

If you do not know when livestock or animal by-products will arrive, give an estimate. If they have already arrived, you can put a date in the past.

RPA need to know this so they can prioritise your application.

components.name: uogTBM
components.title: What's the date livestock or animal by-products will arrive?
components.hint: For example, 27 9 2023. If you keep both livestock and animal by-products, tell us the date the first one will arrive.

pages.title: Will you keep livestock or use animal by-products at your home address?

pages.title: National Grid field number for where you'll keep livestock

components.name: GIGZXr
components.content: RPA need the National Grid field number for the main area where you'll keep livestock. For example, if you're a:

components.name: hJJvRZ
components.title: National Grid field number for where you'll keep livestock

components.name: moXMAe
components.content:
If your business uses animal by-products, this will be for the premises where you use them.

Use the MAGIC map (opens in new tab) to find the National Grid field numbers for your land or buildings. Follow these instructions:
  1. 1. Select ‘Get Started’.
  2. 2. Search for a postcode or place.
  3. 3. Using the map, locate the land or building. Use the +/- icons to zoom in and out.
  4. 4. In the top toolbar, select the fourth icon along ('Where am I?') - it looks like a target.
  5. 5. Click on the land or building.
  6. 6. A pop-up box will appear showing the land details for this location. The National Grid field number is the fourth number down and comes after the ‘Grid Ref’ (Ordnance Survey grid reference). It’s made up of 2 letters and 8 numbers, for example, AB 1234 5678.

components.name: sLRVWq
components.title: What's the National Grid field number for the main area where you'll keep livestock or use animal by-products?

pages.title: Will you keep livestock or use animal by-products anywhere else?

components.title: Will you keep livestock or use animal by-products anywhere else?

pages.title: National Grid field number for where you'll keep livestock

components.name: ILcbVH
components.content:
If your business uses animal by-products, this will be for the premises where you use them.

Use the MAGIC map (opens in new tab) to find the National Grid field numbers for your land or buildings. Follow these instructions:
  1. 1. Select ‘Get Started’.
  2. 2. Search for a postcode or place.
  3. 3. Using the map, locate the land or building. Use the +/- icons to zoom in and out.
  4. 4. In the top toolbar, select the fourth icon along ('Where am I?') - it looks like a target.
  5. 5. Click on the land or building.
  6. 6. A pop-up box will appear showing the land details for this location. The National Grid field number is the fourth number down and comes after the ‘Grid Ref’ (Ordnance Survey grid reference). It’s made up of 2 letters and 8 numbers, for example, AB 1234 5678.
